## Natural history notes

The American elm (Ulmus americana) is a large tree that can live for over 300 years. However, the introduction of Dutch elm disease has caused major declines in this species, placing it on the endangered species list. The American elm can be incorporated into native plant gardens, but careful monitoring for Dutch elm disease is necessary to maintain the treeâ€™s health.
